question:
Consider the table

$$\begin{array}{c|ccccc}
x & 1.0 & 1.3 & 1.6 & 1.9 & 2.2   \\
\hline
y & 0.7652 & 0.6201 & 0.4554 & 0.2818 & 0.1104 \\
\end{array}$$

Find the polynomial of degree $2$ that better approximates $f(2.0)$ using Newton's polynomial interpolation.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{R}^{2} \right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x &- &y &+ &z &+ &2t &= &2 \\
2x &+ &3y &+ &7z &+ &4t &= &-1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-2z-2t,\,-1-z,\,z,\,t\right)$ as solution for every $z,t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1-2z,\,-1-z,\,z,\,0\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1,-1,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:

answer1: Matrix multiplication is always commutative if both matrices are diagonal matrices

answer4: none of the options given are correct

Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a),\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(a)$ and $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a).$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6+e^{-1}$
answer3:

(a)=3-e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer4:

(a)=-3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$

question:
Consider the linear application $T: \mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, defined by matrix 
$A=\left[\begin{array}{rr}
 2 & 1\\
 0 & 3
  \end{array}\right]$
  when considering the base $B=\left\{(2,-1),(-3,1)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$. When considered the canonical basis of $\mathbb{R}^2$, the application $T$ is defined by the matrix:

For each $m\in\mathbb{R}$, describe the solutions of the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & y & - & z & = & 1 \\
x & - & 2y & - & z & = & m \\
x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
For $m=-2$, the linear system has infinitely many solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,y-1\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
For $m \neq -2$, the linear system has no solutions.
answer2: The linear system has no solution for every $m\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
For $m \in \{-2,\,0\}$, the linear system has infinitely many solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,y-1\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
For $m=0$, the linear system has a unique solution, which is $\left(0,\,1,\,1\right)$.
For $m \not\in \{-2,\,0\}$, the linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has a unique solution for each $m\in\mathbb{R}$, which is $\left(0,\,m,\,m-1\right)$.

answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

question: Find the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty)\times(0,\infty)\times(0,\infty) \longrightarrow {\mathbb R}$ which is given by $f(x,y,z)=x+\displaystyle \frac{y^2}{4x}+\frac{z^2}{y}+\frac{2}{z}.$
answer2: $M(\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the minimizer and $N(\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the maximizer.
answer3: $M(\frac{1}{2},1,1)$ is the minimizer and $N(\frac{1}{2},1,1)$ is the maximizer.

Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, $f(x,y,z)=x^{2}yz-\cos \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}.$ Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}.$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

$$\begin{cases}
2x &  &  &+ &4z &= &0 \\ 
3x &- &4y &+ &12z &= &0 \\ 
x &- &2y &+ &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-2z,\,\frac{3z}{2},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(-4,3,2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(-2z+y,y,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x &+ &y &- &z &= &1 \\ 
x &+ &y &+ &z &= &2 \\ 
x &- &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ and $\left(1,0,-1\right)$ as its solutions.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,0,x\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer1: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.
answer2: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.

For evaluating the lifespan of tyres of a particular brand, the distances (in km) driven before the tyres were worn out were recorded for a random sample of $100$ cars. 
The data was agregated in a frequency table shown below. Which statement is true? 

$\begin{array}{ |c|c|} 
\hline
\text{Kilometers}&\text{Frequency} \\ 
\hline
0 -30 000& 15\\ 
30 001 - 60 000 & 25\\ 
60 001 - 90 000 & 60\\ 
 \hline
\end{array}$
answer1: The sample range is at least $30 001$ but at most $90 000$.
answer3: The sample range is at least $30 000$ but  at most $90 000$.

$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &5 \\
&5x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &0 \\
& & &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$

Consider the set $\{-2,~ 2,~ 5\}$ of eigenvalues of the real $3 \times 3$ matrix $A+3I$, where $I$ denotes the identity matrix.

$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\
&2x &+ &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

question: Being $T: \mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow\mathbb{R}^2$ a linear application such that $T(x,y,z)=(x+k,z+k)$, with $k\in \mathbb{R}$. Indicate for which values of $k$ that application is linear.

Consider the linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ defined by $T(x,y)= \left(x+y,2x-y,3y\right)$ and the basis $A=\left\{(1,1),(-1,2)\right\}$ and $B=\left\{(0,0,1),(0,2,0),(3,0,0)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $\mathbb{R}^3$, respectively. 
Indicate the transformation matrix $T$ relative to the basis $A$ and $B$.

A consulting firm will carry out two types of projects ($A$ and $B$). The development cost per project $A$ and $B$ is, respectively, $1$ and $2$ monetary units. The requirements in terms of analysts, programmers and terminals for each type of project, are indicated in the following table:

\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Project} & \text{N. of programmers}  & \text{N. of analysts}  & \text{N. of terminals} \\
\hline
\text{A} & 2 & 2 & 3 \\
\text{B} & 3 & 6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

The company wants to minimize the cost of developing projects in the next period. In the development of these projects, at least $10$ programmers and $5$ analysts should be used while the company only has $6$ terminals available. In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model that allows planning the company's activity?
answer1: $x_{i}$ is the number of developed project $i$ ($i=1$, for project $A$ and $i=2$, for project $B$)
answer2: $x_{2}$ is the number of developed projects $B$
answer3: $x_{1}$ is the number of developed projects $A$
answer4: $x$ is the number of developed projects $A$ and $B$

question:
Let be the line $r: \dfrac {x-1} {3} = \dfrac {2-y} {2} = 3-z $ and the plane $\pi: x + 2y-z-2 = 0$. 
Choose the true statement:
answer1: The line $r$ belongs to the plane $\pi$
answer2: The line $r$ is parallel to the plane $\pi$, but outside it.
answer3: The point $A=(7, -2, 1)$ is the unique  intersection point of $r$ and $\pi$.
answer4: The line $r$ is perpendicular to the plane $\pi$.

answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$
answer3: The space generated by $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is $\mathbb{R}^3$

question:

&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\

\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
